resources.string:
To play Cho-han you need: 
		• Two standard six-sided dice, 
		• A cup or bowl to shake and conceal the dice, 
		• A person to act as the "dealer" who rolls the dice, 
		• Players who will place bets

The dealer takes two dice and places them inside a cup or bowl. 
After that dealer shake the cup with dice inside and then places the cup down. 
 
	Players place their bets on cho or han: 
		• Cho (even) - 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12 
		• Han (odd) - 3, 5, 7, 9, 11 
 
	Dealer reveals dices, and sum is calculated

\t• Multiple Betting Rounds: Sometimes, players can place side bets or bet against each other. \n\t• House Dealer: In organized gambling, the dealer may collect a fee or portion of winnings for acting as the house. Players can play against the house.
